text: oatmeal raisin cookies what's not to
love
but you're going to fall in love with
these even more because they're made
with whole wheat they're butter free
fiber rich oats even more delicious and
nutritious so I'm starting with one cup
of whole wheat flour to that add half a
cup of toasted wheat germ this is what's
kicking around in the back of your
fridge comes in a big jar great way to
use up the rest of it also really high
in folic acid heart-healthy fats and
fiber to that add one teaspoon of baking
soda this is going to give us nice
texture teaspoon of ground cinnamon
flavor and 1/2 teaspoon coarse salt
whisk all this together
already smelling really homey with that
cinnamon okay let's work on the wet
ingredients starting with 2/3 cup
vegetable oil I'm using safflower oil
here nice neutral oil 3/4 cup dark brown
sugar the dark brown sugar has more of
that molasses II flavor which is really
tasty and helps make it seem even more
decadent 2 eggs and 1 teaspoon vanilla
extract this little bowl is also
smelling delicious because of the
vanilla you can either whisker stir this
make sure it's just really well combined
alright so now we're going to fold the
wet ingredients into the dry so these
cookies are so easy to throw together
you can make them after school for
little snacks you can make them for
dinner this also makes a really great
contribution for bake sales if you're
just trying to add something that's
still really tasty but has some stealth
health benefits so now let's add the
stars of the show two and a half cups
old-fashioned rolled oats and 1 cup of
raisins now if you didn't want to add
raisins you could also add any other
dried fruit of your liking give this a
big stir this is the hard part not
getting in and eating the raw batter but
I promise you once these are baked you
will be so excited so we're going to
make about 2 tbsp portion balls if you
have a
small ice cream scoop this is a great
task for that because you make sure you
get really nice even cookies so this
should make about two dozen the scoop
also makes portioning super simple and
this is really fun for kids to help out
with if you happen to have some little
hands in the kitchen bake these at 325
degrees until they are nice and golden
and fragrant about 13 minutes so I've
let these cookies cool slightly on the
pans that gives them a nice crust on the
bottom but we'll let them cool all the
way on a cooling rack here they smell
heavenly cannot wait to try them last
one
perfect all right let's try
mmm whole grain goodness and an update
on a classic this calls for a glass milk
